resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

+

TheNeuralBit commented on a change in pull request #2200: ARROW-2777: [JS] Friendlier onboarding readme
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2200#discussion_r204092840
 
 

 ##########
 File path: js/README.md
 ##########
 @@ -83,6 +84,31 @@ console.log(table.toString());
 */
 ```
 
+## Create a Table from JavaScript arrays
+
+```es6
+const fields = [{
+        name: 'precipitation',
+        type: { name: 'floatingpoint', precision: 'SINGLE'},
+        nullable: false, children: []
+    }, {
+        name: 'date',
+        type: { name: 'date', unit: 'MILLISECOND' },
+        nullable: false, children: []
+    }];
+const rainAmounts = Array.from({length: LENGTH}, () => Number((Math.random() * 20).toFixed(1)));
+const rainDates = Array.from({length: LENGTH}, (_, i) => Date.now() - 1000 * 60 * 60 * 24 * i);
+
+const LENGTH = 2000;
+const rainfall = arrow.Table.from({
+  schema: { fields: fields },
+  batches: [{ 
+    count: LENGTH,
+    columns: [
+      {name: "precipitation", count: LENGTH, VALIDITY: [], DATA: rainAmounts },
+      {name: "date",          count: LENGTH, VALIDITY: [], DATA: rainDates } ] }] })
+```
+
 
 Review comment:
   nitpicky, but this won't actually work when copy-pasted because `LENGTH` is defined after the arrays.
   
   It would be really nice if we could finish [ARROW-2766](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2766) to make this example much cleaner. Inferring the types from arrays is difficult though.. so we could do a subset of that functionality that takes a list of already created vectors and a list of names for them. We can _almost_ do this already, I can write up a PR that cleans it up.

----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Based on some recent community feedback, add to JS onboarding:

-- Example of loading native JS values

-- Pointer to Slack

-- Links to tutorials and docs

-- Ideally.. tutorial of loading -> map/filter/reduce -> emitting... but more core methods seem needed first.

comments.body: Note: the Arrow Slack channel is most likely going away.

Great.  I don't have a strong feeling over which synchronous comms channel is preferred. I added Slack b/c I've been having synchronous education comms w/ various expert JS framework devs who are curious about Arrow but have questions. Likewise,  as basic compute fills out over next few months, I expect more beginner q's to start, and an interim period before SO, tutorials, etc. catch up. Slack appeared to be the most "in-the-open" sync comms channel being actively used.

 

Maybe keep now, and if/when a decision is made + new path is established, update?

 

Or clear enough decision that I should delete now, and if so, what should I put instead?

 

Thanks!

I see. I'm not saying that synchronous communication is a bad idea, but Slack in particular has been actively harmful to the health of the project from what we can see looking at the logs. Very few Arrow committers frequent the Slack channel, and people are heading there because of the general trend of corporations moving a lot of comms out of e-mail and into Slack. 

My guess is that the Apache project is unlikely to offer an official synchronous communication channel. The best alternative might be to set up a Discourse instance, but we need to see if ASF infra will support it.
